PLANT AND METHOD FOR THE REALIZATION OF SELF-SUPPORTING MODULES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF REINFORCED-CONCRETE SLABS

abstract.p: Plant for the realization of self-supporting construction modules for the construction of reinforced- concrete slabs, said modules being made up of a plurality of panels having a mutually united shape, in order to be mutually associated. In each of such modules at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) is inserted crossing each panel in longitudinal slots (7), such modules being mutually disposed side by side so as to form a complete slab structure.

description.p: Title: PLANT AND METHOD FOR THE REALIZATION OF SELF- SUPPORTING CONSTRUCTION MODULES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION
OF RE INFORCED - CONCRETE SLABS.
In its general aspect, the present invention refers to a plant and method for the realization of self- supporting construction modules for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs.

The slab can be made up of a plurality of such modules realised by means of the plant, which are each formed by a plurality of panels in plastic, or expanded material, or cardboard material, which are joined to one another, advantageously through connection means, so as to form such modules. The modules laid side by side to one another form the self-supporting structure, on which a cast of concrete is then poured so as to form the actual reinforced-concrete plane.

For the purposes of the present invention by slab we mean that structure which is used to create the ceiling of the rooms positioned below it and to create the floor of the rooms positioned above it. The slabs can be realised in various materials, wood, iron, reinforced- concrete etc.

As it is known, in the field of building constructions, such constructive panels in expanded plastic material are used, preferably made from expanded polystyrene, in the form of boards or profiles with suitable shapes and dimensions, having the function of disposable formwork and thermal insulation. It is also known that in order to confer suitable self-supporting characteristics to such
panels, in each module, one or more rigid reinforcement profiles, for example made from suitably shaped metal, wood, plastic material, or other rigid material, are incorporated or inserted in the mass of plastic material.

In general, in such panels the reinforcing longitudinal elements are inserted in seats, such as recesses or slots, made with suitable dimensions. The aforementioned panels are positioned adjacent to one another in number that is sufficient to form modules of the desired sizes. The reinforcing elements are inserted in the seats and run for a predetermined length, passing through the various panels, over the entire structure of the module.
Therefore the operation of inserting such reinforcing elements is one of the critical points of forming the slab structure.

The Applicant has made a plant and method for the realization of modules for forming the slab structure, in which in particular there is an optimization of the insertion operation of such reinforcing elements, in a plurality of panels previously aligned with one another so as to form a module that is possibly cut or shaped so as to form a module with desired dimensions and shapes. Such a module can constitute a slab per se, or many modules of the same length or even of different lengths can be mutually disposed side by side, so as to form a complete slab structure of the desired sizes.

One aspect of the present invention concerns a plant having the characteristics of the attached claim 1. A further aspect of the present invention concerns a
method having the characteristics of the attached claim 5.

The characteristics and the advantages of the plant according to the present invention shall be highlighted from the following description, given as an example and not for limiting purposes, with reference to the attached figures in which:
• figure 1 illustrates two constructive panels that are associated to one another so as to form a module according to one embodiment of the present invention;
• figure 2a illustrates a layout of the plant for the production of modules according to the present invention;
· figure 2b illustrates an enlarged detail of figure 2a.
• figure 3 illustrates a layout of the plant according to a further embodiment of the invention .

With reference to the mentioned figures, the plant according to the present invention is used to make modules with desired dimensions, which are then applied by being mutually disposed side by side so as to form a complete slab of the desired sizes.

The slab therefore can be formed by a plurality of such modules. In turn, they are each formed by a plurality of panels in plastic material, which may or may not be expanded, or in cardboard, or other material, which are advantageously joined to one another through connection means.

Figure 1 illustrates, as an example, a module that is
formed by two panels that are longitudinally associated to one another.

Each panel is formed by a body or a substantially parallelepiped-shaped plate 2, for example made in expanded plastic material, like expanded polystyrene EPS, having a lower surface that is substantially flat and in which at least one groove 3 is defined, preferably formed on the upper surface and along at least one of the two directions, longitudinal or transversal, of the plate itself. The constructive module illustrated as an example is moreover equipped on the rear and front surfaces of the plate with protuberances 4 and seats 5, having a mutually united shape, so as to be able to associate many plates with one another, so as to form a complete and aligned slab structure. In one alternative embodiment such protuberances and seats and also the grooves may not be present and the plates are simply rested on one another .
The constructive module further comprises at least one longitudinal or transversal reinforcing element 6, which is inserted in longitudinal slots 7 which extend for the entire length of the body.

Such slots can be realised completely inside the panel or can be realised simply through recesses obtained on the upper or lower surface of the panel . Moreover, they can have various shapes, but preferably have, in section, the same shape as the longitudinal reinforcing element which is inserted in them.

Preferably, the slots have variable width in the length direction, so as to promote the insertion of
the longitudinal reinforcing element in modules that are aligned with one another and, at the same time, ensure the catching of such reinforcements inside the module. In particular, during insertion inside the module, each slot has a width that is greater than the thickness of, the reinforcement, so as to promote its insertion, whereas in its intermediate portions and/or also near to the outlet it has a width that substantially corresponds to the thickness of the reinforcement, so as to lock onto it, fixedly connecting it inside the module.

In the illustrated embodiment, said slots have one of the two longitudinal openings with dimensions that are greater than the other, so as to promote the insertion (from the larger opening) of the longitudinal reinforcing element in the modules fixedly connected to one another. Indeed, the shape of the slots makes it possible, during the insertion operations of the longitudinal reinforcement, to minimise the strain due to friction with the walls of the slot. Moreover, the effects of possible small misalignments at the opening of the reinforcement can be avoided. In particular, such slots have a front inlet opening for the reinforcing element having greater dimensions with respect to a rear outlet opening of the reinforcement itself.
Nothing, in any case, prevents the profiles from being inserted, maybe with greater difficulty, from the opposite side of the slot.
Preferably, the inside of the slot has the shape of a truncated cone.

The reinforcing element advantageously has a "Z" , C ,
T, I, Ω -shaped section that are shapes which offer a strong resistance to the stress which the structure can undergo.

The plant according to the present invention, as illustrated in the schematic layout of figure 2 receives panels P in inlet, alternatively positioned one after the other, and proceeds to line up panels P one after the other on an aligning plane A, for example through at least one insertion mechanism I . Along such a plane, an aligning and cutting mechanism AT operates, which can preferably slide on a longitudinal rail B , arranged on one of the two sides of the aligning plane. Such a mechanism is capable of aligning (and positioning adjacent to one another) a predetermined number of panels and possibly cut at least one panel after they have been aligned with one another, in order to form a module M of the size requested.

Such a mechanism comprises, for such a purpose, a blade L or a hot wire, a vibrant wire, or a simple blade or a circular saw, or other systems of the known type which are also capable of operating in an inclined position and not only orthogonal with respect to the longitudinal axis XI of the aligning plane. In such a way modules can be obtained which have a trapezoidal - shape rather than parallelepiped-shape, when the slab to be generated is not simply rectangular, but has particular shapes which can only be formed by building modules with just as particular shapes.

Once the shape of a module has been formed, it is moved onto an adjacent forming machine F, provided with means for holding the module free from reinforcing elements, in which, from side to side, at least one hardening or
reinforcing longitudinal element 7 is inserted.

Such an operation is carried out with, for example the aid of a winding reel S around which the profile is wound forming the reinforcing element . From such a reel the profile is unwound, which is shaped with the desired shape through a forming machine PR positioned and cut by the right amount through a positioning or straightening means R provided with suitable cutting means .

Alternatively, an automatic pressing-bending machine from the non-bent sheet originates such a reinforcing element, shaped with the desired shape, at the outlet of which such forming machine is positioned.
In a further embodiment, the profiles can already be manufactured and such machines can be omitted from the plant .

If such a profile is already correctly positioned by the forming machine, such a straightening machine can be omitted and it is only necessary for the plant to be provided with cutting means for the longitudinal reinforcement elements. In the case in which the elements are manufactured with the right length, also the cutting means can be omitted.

The forming machine, is positioned downstream of the forming machine and receives the reinforcing longitudinal elements in inlet. Through such catching means of the module, free from reinforcing elements, it keeps the module itself in the correct position, so that when the profile shaped as a longitudinal reinforcing element proceeds pushed by the unwinding of the reel, it is inserted inside it.

The forming machine is capable of moving such a module
transversally, since it is provided with means for translating in particular in a direction Y that is orthogonal to the forward movement axis of the reinforcing elements. In such a way, the module can be moved (along the direction of arrow F) so as to allow the insertion of further reinforcing elements in further slots, parallel to the previous ones.

The forming machine in the illustrated embodiment has a gondola- shaped structure G, inside which the module is inserted from the open part of the gondola, and the catching means comprise pistons PI, for example hydraulic, that are arranged vertically and cooperate with suitable basements PD, on which the module rests, blocking the panels. The gondola has translation means which allow it to move in the direction indicated by arrows F in figure 2b, which corresponds to a direction parallel to axis Y indicated in figure 2a.

Once the reinforcing elements have been inserted in the module by the desired length, for example completely inserted inside the module, they are cut by the mentioned cutting means and the completed module is positioned automatically downstream from the forming machine in a store Z. Such a store is equipped with suitable means for moving the modules, comprising for example a roller mechanism RR, which position the modules in a line ready for being stored and taken in the desired manner.
In brief the method for the realization of self- supporting construction modules according to the embodiment illustrated in figures 2a and 2b, of the present invention foresees the following steps:

a) alignment along a longitudinal axis XI and making
adjacent to one another on an aligning plane A, a predetermined number of panels so as to form a module of the desired sizes, if necessary cutting the module to the requested length and shape, b) positioning the module in a predetermined position and fixedly keeping it in such a position,
c) longitudinally inserting, along such an axis XI in such a module, the reinforcing element 6 in respective slot 7,
d) cutting, if necessary, the end of the reinforcing element once it has been inserted by the desired size in the module.

Subsequently, if further reinforcing elements are desired to be inserted inside the module, the method foresees repeating, as many times as the number of further elements which are wished to be inserted, the following steps:

e) transversally displacing along a transversal axis Y the module in which a reinforcing element has been inserted in a slot 7, so as to make a further slot of the module correspond with the cut end of the longitudinal reinforcing element,
f) longitudinally inserting, in such a module, reinforcing element 6 in further slot 7,
g) cutting the end of the reinforcing element once it has been inserted by the desired size in the module, if necessary.
Step e) could alternatively be obtained by keeping the module still and by transversally moving the longitudinal reinforcing element.

In the embodiment of figure 3, the plant according to the present invention comprises means for the
positioning of the reinforcement profiles on the plant that in turn comprises a winding reel S' around which the profile is wound forming the reinforcing element. From such a reel the profile unwinds, said profile being shaped with the desired shape through a forming machine PR' positioned and cut by the right amount, through a positioning or straightening means R' that is provided with suitable cutting means.
Alternatively, an automatic pressing- bending machine of the non-bent sheet originates such a reinforcing element, shaped with the desired shape.

In a further embodiment, the profiles can already be manufactured and such machines can be omitted from the plant. In the case in which the reinforcing elements are manufactured with the right length, also the cutting means R' can be omitted.

In the present embodiment the forming machine, downstream of the group of such positioning means, comprises a sheet collection bench BR' , provided with movement means for moving the bench along the forward movement direction of sheet X and along its orthogonal direction Y. Downstream of such a bench means S' for moving forward the reinforcing elements are provided comprising at least one calender, capable of moving such elements forwards.

Downstream of such a calender, the plant comprises an insertion mechanism I that proceeds to line up panels P' one after the other on an aligning plane A' . Along such a plane, an aligning and cutting mechanism AT' operates. Such a mechanism is capable of aligning (and positioning adjacent to one another) a predetermined number of panels and possibly cutting at least one
panel after they have been aligned with one another, in order to form a module M' of the size requested.

The forward movement means S insert the reinforcing elements in the modules to the desired length. The aligning and cutting mechanism operates so as to cut the panels in relation to the length of the reinforcing elements .

Once the reinforcing elements have been inserted in the module to the desired length, for example completely inserted in the module, the completed module itself is positioned in a store Z' . Such a store is equipped with suitable means for moving the modules, comprising for example a roller mechanism RR' , which position the modules one after the other ready to be stored and taken in the desired manner.
The method for the realization of the modules of the plant of figure 3 is carried out in the following manner :
a) alignment along a longitudinal axis XI of a plurality of reinforcing elements 6 of a predetermined length on a sheet collection bench BR' ,

b) downstream of such a bench, aligning along a longitudinal axis XI and making adjacent to one another, on an aligning plane A' , a predetermined number of panels to form a module of the desired dimensions ,
c) longitudinally inserting, along such an axis XI', the reinforcing element 6' in such a module in the respective slot of the module
d) cutting, if necessary, the end of such a module.

claim.claim-text: 1. Plant for the realization of self-supporting construction modules, for the construction of reinforced- concrete slabs, said modules being made up of a plurality of panels, each having a mutually united shape, in order to be mutually associated, in each of such modules at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) being inserted, which crosses each panel in longitudinal slots (7) , such modules being mutually disposed side by side, forming a complete slab structure,
characterised in that it comprises
at least one aligning plane (A) on which a predetermined number of panels is aligned, in order to create a module (M) of the size requested,

at least one forming machine (F) , provided with catching means of the module free from reinforcing elements, in which it is inserted, from side to side, at least one hardening or reinforcing longitudinal element (6) .
2. Plant according to claim 1, wherein the aligning and cutting mechanism (AT) , which can slide on a longitudinal rail (B) , is disposed on one of the two sides of the aligning plane.

3. Plant according to claim 1, wherein such an aligning and cutting mechanism comprises a hot wire, a vibrant wire, or a simple blade (L) or a circular saw, or other systems of the known type, which are also able to provide inclined cuttings and not only orthogonal cuttings with respect to the longitudinal axis (XI) of the aligning plane.

4. Plant according to claim 1, wherein the reinforcing element (6) is pushed by means of an automatic pressing bending machine from the non-bent sheet originating such a reinforcing element, shaped with the desired shape, at the outlet of which such forming machine is positioned.
5. Plant according to claim 1, wherein the reinforcing element (6) is pushed by means of at least one calender (S') .

6. Method for the realization of self-supporting construction modules for the construction of reinforced- concrete slabs, said modules being made up of a plurality of panels, having a mutually united shape, in order to be mutually associated, in each of such modules at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) being inserted crossing each panel in longitudinal slots (7) , such modules disposed side by side forming a complete slab structure,
characterised in that it comprises the following steps :
a) alignment along a longitudinal axis (XI) and making mutually adjacent, on an aligning plane (A) , a predetermined number of panels to form a module of the desired sizes,
b) positioning the module in a predetermined position and firmly keeping it in such a position,
c) longitudinally inserting, along such an axis (XI) in such a module, the reinforcing element (6) in the respective slot (7) ,
d) cutting, if necessary, the end of the reinforcing element once it has been inserted for the desired size in the module.
7. Method according to claim 6, successively comprising the steps of:

e) transversally displacing along a transversal axis (Y) of the module, wherein a reinforcing element has been inserted in a slot (7) , in order to correspond a further slot of the module with the cut end of the longitudinal reinforcing element, f) longitudinally inserting, in such a module, the reinforcing element (6) in the further slot (7) , g) cutting, if necessary, the end of the reinforcing element once it has been inserted for the desired size in the module.
8. Method according to claim 6, successively comprising the steps of:

e) transversally displacing, along a transversal axis (Y) , a further reinforcing element, in order to make a further slot of the module correspond with the cut end of such further longitudinal reinforcing element,
f) longitudinally inserting, in such a module, the further reinforcing element (6) in the further slot (7)
g) cutting, if necessary, the end of the reinforcing element, once it has been inserted for the desired size in the module.
9. Method according to claims 7 and 8, wherein the steps e) to g) are further repeated for a number of times corresponding to how many longitudinal elements must be inserted in the module.
10. Method according to claim 6, wherein such an alignment step also comprises the step of cutting at least one panel, along a direction orthogonal to the longitudinal axis (XI) .

11. Method for the realization of self- supporting construction modules for the construction of reinforced- concrete slabs, said modules being made up of a plurality of panels having a mutually united shape, in order to be mutually associated, in each of such modules at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) being inserted, which crosses each panel in longitudinal slots (7), such modules being mutually disposed side by side forming a complete slab structure,
characterised in that it comprises the following steps :
a) alignment along a longitudinal axis (XI) of a plurality of reinforcing elements (6) of a predetermined length on a sheet collection bench

b) downstream of such a bench aligning along a longitudinal axis (XI) and making mutually adjacent on an aligning plane (A) , a predetermined number of panels to form a module of the desired dimensions ,
c) longitudinally inserting, along such an axis (XI) in such a module, the reinforcing element (6) in the respective slot (7) of the module
d) cutting, if necessary, the end of such a module.
